intro: Tectaria melanorachis, commonly known as the black-veined shield fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Tectariaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, leathery, dark-green fronds with prominent, blackish veins. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forests and rocky areas. Its sporangia are clustered in sori on the underside of the fronds, which are covered by a protective indusium. Tectaria melanorachis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, showcasing its adaptability to humid climates.
